headquarters: Somerset, New Jersey, USA (US operations); Nanjing, China (R&D center)

executive_summary.overview: Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company focused on discovering and developing novel cell therapies for oncology and other indications. The company's lead product, CARVYKTI (ciltacabtagene autoleucel), is a BCMA-directed CAR-T cell therapy approved for relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma. CARVYKTI is commercialized through a global partnership with Johnson & Johnson (Janssen), representing one of the most significant CAR-T collaborations in the industry.
executive_summary.investment_thesis: Legend Biotech represents a high-conviction opportunity in the CAR-T cell therapy market with best-in-class clinical data for CARVYKTI. The April 2024 earlier-line FDA approval significantly expands the addressable market. Strong J&J partnership provides commercial infrastructure and risk-sharing. Probability-weighted DCF analysis suggests meaningful upside from current levels, though competitive threats from bispecific antibodies and execution risks warrant attention.
key_highlights: CARVYKTI achieved blockbuster trajectory with 2024 sales exceeding $1.5 billion (company share ~50%)
FDA approval in April 2024 for earlier-line multiple myeloma (1-3 prior therapies) significantly expanded addressable market
Best-in-class efficacy: 98% ORR, 83% sCR, 34.9 month median PFS in CARTITUDE-1
Strong partnership with J&J provides commercial infrastructure and risk sharing
Robust pipeline including next-gen CAR-T candidates and solid tumor programs
Significant manufacturing scale-up investments addressing capacity constraints

key_drivers: Expanding approved indications beyond hematological malignancies
Earlier-line treatment approvals increasing patient pool
Manufacturing improvements reducing turnaround time and costs

major_players.notes: First BCMA CAR-T approved; facing competitive pressure from CARVYKTI; weaker efficacy data
major_players.comparison_to_carvykti: ORR 73% vs 98%, sCR 33% vs 83%, median PFS 8.8 vs 34.9 months

major_players.notes: First CAR-T approved (2017); established manufacturing footprint; different target
Leading CD19 CAR-T franchise; strong in lymphoma; different indication
Best-in-class efficacy data; rapidly gaining market share; earlier-line approval

key_products.name: Tecvayli (teclistamab)
key_products.limitations: Lower durability vs CAR-T, continuous dosing required

key_products.name: Talvey (talquetamab)
key_products.differentiation: Novel target, can be used post-BCMA therapy

bispecific_antibodies.market_dynamics: Bispecifics expected to capture ~30% of addressable MM market, primarily CAR-T ineligible patients

allogeneic_car_t.challenge: Durability and persistence remain unproven vs autologous

chinese_car_t_players.concern: Lower manufacturing costs could pressure pricing long-term

treatment_landscape.car_t_positioning: 3rd line and beyond (moving to 2nd line with CARTITUDE-4)

key_trends: Treatment moving to earlier lines (1-3 prior therapies vs 4+)
MRD-negativity becoming key endpoint and potential cure marker
Improved patient selection and manufacturing reducing dropout

regulatory_environment.fda_stance: Generally supportive with accelerated pathways available
key_regulatory_requirements: REMS (Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy) programs required
Long-term follow-up studies for secondary malignancy risk

secondary_malignancy_investigation.impact: Class-wide boxed warning added in November 2023
secondary_malignancy_investigation.assessment: Does not fundamentally change risk-benefit profile; incidence ~0.5-1%

carvykti_detailed.mechanism: BCMA-directed CAR-T cell therapy with two BCMA-binding domains (VHH nanobody)
carvykti_detailed.differentiation: Dual-epitope binding provides higher affinity and potentially better efficacy

approved_indications.significance: First BCMA CAR-T approved in earlier line; significantly expands addressable market

cartitude_1.trial_design: Single-arm Phase 1b/2 in heavily pretreated RRMM

cartitude_4.trial_design: Randomized Phase 3 vs standard of care (PVd or DPd)
cartitude_4.significance: Transformational data enabling earlier-line treatment paradigm shift

head_to_head_vs_abecma.interpretation: CARVYKTI demonstrates superior efficacy; different trial populations warrant caution

delayed_neurotoxicity.manifestations: Movement disorders (Parkinsonism), cognitive impairment, cranial nerve palsies
delayed_neurotoxicity.impact_assessment: Manageable with early intervention; does not appear to worsen over time in most cases

cytopenias.management: Growth factors, transfusions; expected with CAR-T

secondary_malignancies.assessment: Risk-benefit remains strongly favorable given disease context

key_growth_drivers: Earlier-line approval (April 2024) dramatically expanding patient pool
Manufacturing capacity expansion enabling more treatments

pricing.pricing_outlook: Stable near-term; potential pressure as market matures and competition intensifies

clinical_stage_programs.indication: Newly diagnosed, transplant ineligible multiple myeloma

clinical_stage_programs.status: Dose escalation ongoing; preliminary efficacy signals positive
Early clinical development in China and US
clinical_stage_programs.note: Solid tumor CAR-T has historically high failure rate; high-risk/high-reward

profit_sharing.china: Legend commercializes; pays royalties to J&J
profit_sharing.note: J&J records gross sales; Legend records its profit share

strategic_benefits: Access to J&J's world-class oncology commercial infrastructure
Global reach and established KOL relationships
considerations: 50% profit share limits upside capture for Legend shareholders
Dependency on J&J for commercial execution
J&J also commercializes bispecifics (Tecvayli, Talvey) - potential priority conflicts

j_j_incentives.analysis: J&J appears committed to CARVYKTI success despite bispecific portfolio
j_j_incentives.concern: Bispecifics require less infrastructure investment; could shift priority long-term

current_capacity.turnaround_time: Reduced from ~4 weeks to targeting <2 weeks

competitive_assessment.strength: Manufacturing execution has improved significantly; capacity no longer primary constraint
competitive_assessment.ongoing_challenge: Autologous manufacturing inherently more complex than off-the-shelf alternatives
competitive_assessment.mitigation: Continuous process improvement; potential allogeneic platform development

competitive_moats.description: 98% ORR, 83% sCR, 34.9 month median PFS unmatched by any competitor
competitive_moats.durability: HIGH - clinical data is validated and durable
competitive_moats.threat: Next-gen CAR-Ts may eventually match efficacy

competitive_moats.description: Only BCMA CAR-T approved for 1-3 prior lines (CARTITUDE-4)
Access to world-class oncology commercial organization globally
$500M+ investment in capacity; leading turnaround times
competitive_moats.threat: CDMOs building CAR-T capacity; competitors scaling

competitive_moats.description: Unique CAR design with two BCMA-binding domains
competitive_moats.durability: MEDIUM - protected by IP but can be engineered around
competitive_moats.threat: Next-gen constructs may offer similar or better binding

board_of_directors.diversity: Good mix of scientific, commercial, and financial expertise

key_members.name: Ying Huang, Ph.D.
key_members.background: 20+ years biotech experience; PhD in molecular biology
key_members.assessment: Strong scientific leadership; deep understanding of CAR-T technology

key_members.name: Frank Zhang
key_members.background: Serial entrepreneur in biotech; commercial experience

key_members.name: Albert Hu
key_members.background: Former CFO of multiple public biotech companies

major_shareholders.relationship: Original parent company; spun off Legend in 2017
major_shareholders.alignment: Long-term holder; aligned with value creation

major_shareholders.assessment: Significant skin in the game; aligned incentives

ownership_structure.adr_structure: Listed on NASDAQ; each ADS represents 2 ordinary shares
ownership_structure.share_class: Single class of ordinary shares (one share, one vote)

executive_compensation.concerns: None significant; compensation appears reasonable for company stage

concerns: Chinese R&D operations create some governance complexity
Dependency on J&J partnership for key decisions
Dual listing complexity (potential for Cayman Islands structure issues)

governance_score.rationale: Strong independent board, aligned ownership, clear governance practices. Minor deductions for China operations complexity and partnership dependency.

income_statement.note: Legend records its share of CARVYKTI profits; J&J records gross sales

fy2025_estimate.note: Path to profitability; first positive operating income year

peer_comparison.assessment: Legend trades at premium justified by superior growth trajectory

key_assumptions.wacc_calculation: Calculated as Rf + Beta * ERP; adjusted for biotech/commercial stage

carvykti_base_model.note: Peak in 2029-2030, then 3% annual erosion from competition/genericization

super_bear.description: Major setbacks leading to significant value destruction
key_assumptions: CARVYKTI sales plateau at $1.8B total (Legend share ~$0.9B) due to serious safety signals or competitive displacement
FDA imposes additional restrictions on CAR-T due to secondary malignancy concerns
Bispecific antibodies capture 50%+ of addressable market
Manufacturing issues lead to supply disruptions
All pipeline candidates fail in clinical trials
J&J deprioritizes CARVYKTI in favor of bispecifics

bear.description: Below expectations due to competitive pressure and execution challenges
key_assumptions: CARVYKTI peak sales of $4.5B total (Legend share ~$2.25B)
Earlier-line adoption achieves only 60% of base case expectations
Bispecifics capture 35-40% of addressable market
CARTITUDE-5 frontline trial fails or shows modest benefit
Manufacturing adequate but costs remain elevated
Only LB1901 advances to Phase 2; other pipeline fails
Profitability delayed to 2027

base.description: Current trajectory continues with solid execution
key_assumptions: CARVYKTI achieves $6B peak global sales (Legend share ~$3B)
Earlier-line indication becomes primary revenue driver by 2028
CARTITUDE-5 frontline data positive, approval in 2027
Bispecifics capture ~30% of addressable market (primarily CAR-T ineligible)
Manufacturing scales successfully to meet demand
LB1901 advances to pivotal trials; approval 2028-2029
One additional pipeline candidate shows promise
Profitability achieved in 2025

bull.description: Strong execution with expanded indications and market leadership
key_assumptions: CARVYKTI peak global sales reach $8B (Legend share ~$4B)
CARTITUDE-5 frontline data transformational; rapid adoption
CARTITUDE studies demonstrate definitive superiority, enabling market share gains vs all competitors
CAR-T established as curative-intent standard of care in MM
LB1901 approved with $500M+ peak sales potential
LB2102 solid tumor program shows breakthrough activity
Manufacturing becomes competitive advantage with industry-leading turnaround
Operating margins expand to 38%+ at scale

super_bull.description: Transformational success across multiple indications and potential M&A premium

Multiple myeloma approaches functional cure with CAR-T for significant patient subset
Solid tumor breakthrough with LB2102 (Claudin 18.2) reaching $2B+ peak
Additional indications (AL amyloidosis, other B-cell malignancies) add $1B+
Next-gen CAR-T extends franchise beyond initial product lifecycle
Potential acquisition by large pharma at significant premium
Operating margins exceed 42%

probability_weighted_price.rationale_for_10_percent: Appropriate for commercial-stage biotech with: (1) validated product generating revenue, (2) J&J partnership de-risking execution, (3) binary clinical risks in pipeline, (4) sector beta of ~1.4. Range of 9-11% is reasonable.

multi_agent_debate.format: 10-round structured debate with Bull, Bear, and Critic perspectives
multi_agent_debate.objective: Challenge and refine assumptions through adversarial discussion

rounds.bull_argument: CARVYKTI peak sales of $6B+ is achievable based on: (1) best-in-class 98% ORR and 34.9 month median PFS, (2) earlier-line approval expanding addressable market 3-4x, (3) ongoing frontline trials, (4) global expansion. The $6B peak for Legend's share ($3B) is conservative given potential.
rounds.bear_argument: Peak sales will be capped at $4-4.5B due to: (1) bispecific antibodies capturing 35-40% of market with off-the-shelf convenience, (2) pricing pressure as market matures, (3) next-gen CAR-Ts eroding share, (4) inherent manufacturing scalability limits of autologous therapy.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: What specific evidence supports 3-4x market expansion? Earlier-line patients have more treatment options and may prefer less intensive bispecifics first. Bear: If bispecifics are truly competitive, why has CARVYKTI maintained commercial momentum despite Tecvayli availability since 2022?
rounds.resolution: Peak sales likely $5.5-7B range (Legend share $2.75-3.5B). Earlier-line approval does expand market significantly, but bispecifics will serve CAR-T ineligible patients (~30%). Adjust base case peak from $6B to $5.5-6.5B range.

rounds.bull_argument: Bispecifics (Tecvayli, Talvey, Elrexfio) serve a different patient population - primarily CAR-T ineligible patients due to age, comorbidities, or logistics. Head-to-head data when available will show CAR-T's superiority in depth and durability of response. CAR-T is curative-intent; bispecifics are chronic therapy.
rounds.bear_argument: Bispecifics are more convenient (no manufacturing delay, no leukapheresis), cheaper (~$150-200K vs $465K), and showing improving durability data. Many physicians and patients will choose convenience over marginally better efficacy. J&J commercializes both CARVYKTI and Tecvayli - conflicting incentives.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: Curative-intent is aspirational marketing, not proven. Most patients still relapse after CAR-T. Bear: Cost argument ignores continuous bispecific dosing vs one-time CAR-T. Total cost of care may favor CAR-T for responding patients.
rounds.resolution: Bispecifics will capture ~30% of addressable market (primarily CAR-T ineligible). Market will segment rather than winner-take-all. Include bispecific competition explicitly in bear and super-bear scenarios.

rounds.bull_argument: CARTITUDE-5 frontline data should succeed based on: (1) strong mechanistic rationale for earlier intervention, (2) CARTITUDE-4 success in earlier lines, (3) trial design with primary endpoint of PFS which is more achievable than OS. Probability of success: 70%.
rounds.bear_argument: Frontline MM is different from relapsed setting. Patients have many effective options (VRd, daratumumab combinations). Trial must show dramatic improvement to change practice. CAR-T toxicity may be less acceptable in treatment-naive patients. Probability: 45%.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: CARTITUDE-4 was in lenalidomide-refractory patients - not truly frontline. Extrapolation is risky. Bear: Why would CAR-T not work better in fitter, less pretreated patients? The biology should favor earlier intervention.
rounds.resolution: CARTITUDE-5 probability of success: 55-65%. Reduce bull case assumption from 70% to 60%. Frontline success would add $2-3B to peak sales potential but is not in base case.

rounds.bull_argument: Delayed neurotoxicity (~5-7%) is manageable and does not fundamentally change risk-benefit. It emerges primarily in heavily pretreated patients. With earlier intervention and better monitoring, incidence may be lower. Most cases are manageable with early intervention.
rounds.bear_argument: This signal is unique to CARVYKTI (not seen with Abecma). As CARVYKTI moves to earlier lines with longer expected survival, patients may be unwilling to accept Parkinson-like symptoms. This could become a significant commercial headwind.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: Do you have data showing lower incidence in less pretreated patients? Bear: Has there been any evidence of physician reluctance or patient refusal due to this risk?
rounds.resolution: Delayed neurotoxicity is a legitimate monitoring point but has not materially impacted commercial trajectory. Include as downside risk in scenarios; monitor closely with CARTITUDE-4 real-world data.

rounds.bull_argument: Legend/J&J have invested $500M+ in manufacturing, reduced turnaround from 4 weeks to <2 weeks, and built capacity for 10,000+ patients annually. This is now a competitive advantage, not a constraint. First-mover scale creates barriers.
rounds.bear_argument: Autologous CAR-T manufacturing is inherently limited by patient-specific production. CDMOs (Lonza, WuXi) are building CAR-T capacity that will benefit competitors. Allogeneic CAR-T, if successful, would eliminate Legend's manufacturing moat entirely.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: What prevents competitors from making similar investments? Bear: Allogeneic has failed to show durability in multiple trials. Why cite it as near-term threat?
rounds.resolution: Manufacturing is currently adequate and improving, but is medium-durability moat (2-4 years). Allogeneic threat is 5+ years away if at all. Maintain base case manufacturing assumptions.

rounds.bull_argument: J&J partnership is enormously valuable: provides world-class commercial infrastructure, regulatory expertise, risk-sharing on $500M+ development costs, and remaining $1B+ in milestones. Strong alignment of incentives - J&J wants CARVYKTI to succeed.
rounds.bear_argument: The 50/50 profit split means Legend captures only half the upside. J&J also commercializes Tecvayli and Talvey (bispecifics) which compete for the same patients. J&J may prioritize lower-investment bispecifics over high-investment CAR-T.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: If J&J is so aligned, why are they aggressively pushing Tecvayli in the same indication? Bear: Has there been any evidence of J&J deprioritizing CARVYKTI investment?
rounds.resolution: Partnership is net positive for Legend at current stage. Risk-sharing outweighs profit split concern. Monitor J&J's relative investment in CAR-T vs bispecifics as potential early warning.

rounds.bull_argument: Pipeline is undervalued. LB1901 (CD4) addresses unmet need in T-cell lymphoma with no approved CAR-T. LB2102 (CLDN18.2) could be transformational in solid tumors. Combined pipeline NPV should be $1.5B+.
rounds.bear_argument: Pipeline is overvalued. CD4 CAR-T will face T-cell depletion challenges. CLDN18.2 CAR-T in solid tumors has high failure probability (>80% historically). Base case should assume minimal pipeline value.
rounds.critic_challenge: Bull: What is the probability of success you're assigning to solid tumor CAR-T? Historical data suggests <10% success rate. Bear: If pipeline has minimal value, how do you explain the $800M+ market cap implied for non-CARVYKTI assets?
rounds.resolution: Use probability-weighted pipeline values: LB1901 at 35% probability ($175M NPV), LB2102 at 20% probability ($150M NPV), other at 15% ($125M NPV). Total: $450-600M in base case.

rounds.topic: Path to Profitability and Cash Position
rounds.bull_argument: Legend has clear path to profitability in 2025 with $1.3B cash position providing 8+ years runway. No dilution risk. Operating leverage as CARVYKTI scales will drive rapid margin expansion.
rounds.bear_argument: Profitability depends on CARVYKTI trajectory maintaining. If competition slows growth, R&D continues at high levels for pipeline, and margins compress, profitability could be delayed to 2027+.
rounds.critic_challenge: Both positions appear reasonable. What specific metrics would signal profitability is on/off track?
rounds.resolution: Profitability timing is 2025-2026 in base/bull, 2027 in bear. Monitor quarterly: gross margin trend, R&D as % of revenue, operating cash flow. Current cash position ($1.3B) provides ample cushion.

rounds.bull_argument: 9% WACC is appropriate for Legend given: (1) commercial-stage de-risking vs pure clinical biotech, (2) J&J partnership reducing execution risk, (3) strong balance sheet, (4) sector beta of 1.3-1.4 implies 9-10% cost of equity.
rounds.bear_argument: 11% WACC is appropriate due to: (1) pipeline binary risks, (2) competitive uncertainty, (3) China operations complexity, (4) biotech sector volatility, (5) small-cap premium.
rounds.critic_challenge: What discount rate would you use for Gilead (Yescarta owner)? If Legend deserves higher discount rate, what's the premium for its specific risks?
rounds.resolution: 10% WACC is appropriate compromise - reflects commercial-stage with partnership de-risking (lower than pure clinical biotech at 12-14%) but acknowledges remaining binary risks and competitive uncertainty (higher than large pharma at 8-9%). Range of 9-11% is reasonable.

rounds.topic: Final Probability Weighting and Fair Value
rounds.bull_argument: Probabilities should skew positive: Super Bear 3%, Bear 15%, Base 45%, Bull 30%, Super Bull 7%. Commercial momentum, clinical data superiority, and upcoming catalysts justify optimism. Fair value: $68-75.
rounds.bear_argument: Probabilities should reflect realistic competitive dynamics: Super Bear 8%, Bear 25%, Base 45%, Bull 18%, Super Bull 4%. Multiple risks (bispecifics, safety signals, pipeline uncertainty) warrant caution. Fair value: $50-55.
rounds.critic_challenge: Both are defending positions rather than seeking truth. What would change your probability assignments? What new data would matter most?
rounds.resolution: Final probabilities: Super Bear 5%, Bear 20%, Base 50%, Bull 20%, Super Bull 5%. This reflects balanced view with commercial momentum (positive) offset by competitive/execution risks (negative). At 10% WACC, probability-weighted fair value = $61.90, rounded to $60 target.

key_consensus_reached: CARVYKTI has demonstrably best-in-class efficacy data
Earlier-line approval materially expands addressable market
Bispecifics represent market segmentation, not winner-take-all displacement
Manufacturing has improved significantly and is not primary constraint
J&J partnership is net positive despite 50% profit share
10% WACC is appropriate for commercial-stage biotech with partnership
Path to profitability in 2025-2026 is credible
key_areas_of_disagreement: Peak sales potential range ($5-8B) reflects genuine uncertainty
Delayed neurotoxicity impact on earlier-line adoption
assumptions_refined_through_debate: Reduced CARTITUDE-5 success probability from 70% to 60%
Increased bear case probability from 15% to 20%
Adjusted peak sales range in base case to $5.5-6.5B
Explicitly modeled bispecific market share capture
Reduced pipeline NPV in base case from $800M to $600M

key_risks_ranked.description: Tecvayli, Talvey, Elrexfio capture larger than expected market share due to convenience and improving efficacy data
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Best-in-class CAR-T efficacy; different patient populations; curative intent positioning
key_risks_ranked.scenario_impact: Bear case assumes 35-40% bispecific market share

key_risks_ranked.description: Delayed neurotoxicity or secondary malignancies lead to FDA restrictions or physician reluctance
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Ongoing monitoring; risk-benefit remains favorable; enhanced screening protocols
key_risks_ranked.scenario_impact: Super-bear case assumes significant safety-driven adoption headwinds

key_risks_ranked.description: Frontline MM trial fails to show meaningful PFS benefit vs standard of care
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Strong earlier-line data; frontline is upside, not base case

key_risks_ranked.description: Quality issues, capacity constraints, or turnaround time degradation limiting commercial potential
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: $500M+ investment; improving track record; J&J support
key_risks_ranked.scenario_impact: Bear case assumes manufacturing costs remain elevated

key_risks_ranked.description: LB1901, LB2102, or other pipeline programs fail in clinical development
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Pipeline is optionality, not core thesis; diversified programs
key_risks_ranked.scenario_impact: Bear/super-bear assume pipeline failures; bull/super-bull assume success

key_risks_ranked.description: J&J deprioritizes CARVYKTI investment in favor of lower-cost bispecific programs
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Contractual commitments; aligned financial incentives; continued J&J investment visible

key_risks_ranked.description: Payer pushback, IRA implications, or competitive dynamics compress net pricing
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Value-based contracts; outcomes data; oncology often protected from aggressive negotiation

key_risks_ranked.description: US-China tensions affecting Legend's Nanjing R&D operations or regulatory environment
key_risks_ranked.mitigation: Core value from ex-China markets; US operations fully established

near_term_2025.impact_if_positive: +$10-15 to price target; validates frontline opportunity
near_term_2025.impact_if_negative: -$5-8 to price target; limits expansion narrative

near_term_2025.impact: Each $100M beat vs consensus adds ~$2-3 to fair value; miss subtracts similar
MEDIUM-HIGH - demonstrates sustainable business model; attracts new investor base

rationale: Best-in-class CARVYKTI efficacy data (98% ORR, 83% sCR, 34.9 month median PFS) creates sustainable competitive advantage
Earlier-line FDA approval (CARTITUDE-4) significantly expands addressable market by 3-4x
Probability-weighted DCF at 10% WACC suggests $60+ fair value vs $45 current price
J&J partnership de-risks commercial execution while providing global infrastructure
Path to profitability in 2025 demonstrates sustainable business model
Multiple near-term catalysts (CARTITUDE-5, pipeline readouts, sales momentum) not fully priced
10-round multi-agent debate refined assumptions and increased confidence in valuation
key_debates_influencing_recommendation: Bispecific competition is real but represents segmentation, not displacement
Delayed neurotoxicity is monitoring point but not deal-breaker
Pipeline provides optionality not reflected in current price
suitable_for: Portfolios seeking asymmetric upside with managed downside
not_suitable_for: Those uncomfortable with biotech binary risks

valuation_table.title: Legend Biotech (LEGN) - Intrinsic Value by Scenario and Discount Rate

analyst_notes.methodology: 10-year probability-weighted DCF with 5 scenarios, refined through 10-round multi-agent debate challenging assumptions from bull, bear, and critic perspectives
key_monitoring_points: Quarterly CARVYKTI sales trajectory vs expectations
Manufacturing capacity utilization and turnaround times
Delayed neurotoxicity incidence in earlier-line patients
model_limitations: Pipeline probabilities based on industry averages, may differ for Legend specifically
China market conservatively modeled given geopolitical uncertainty
Does not include M&A premium which could provide additional upside
analyst_notes.data_sources: Company filings, clinical trial databases, industry reports, consensus estimates, publicly available information through knowledge cutoff
